subject: Climate & Environment
title: Why Insects Matter Most
description: Learn Why Insects Matter Most in one minute.

hook.text: If all humans vanished, Earth would flourish. If all insects vanished, most life would collapse.

buildup.text: Insects pollinate 75% of crops, decompose waste, and feed birds, bats, and fish.

discovery.text: A German study found flying insect biomass dropped 76% in protected areas over 27 years.

twist.text: Pesticides, habitat loss, and light pollution are driving what scientists call an 'insect apocalypse.'

climax.text: Without insect pollinators, one-third of the food we eat would simply vanish from farms.

punchline.text: The tiny creatures we ignore hold the whole system together.

quiz.question: What percentage of crops depend on insect pollinators?
